oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Downward categoricity from a successor inside a good frame
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Vasey, Sebastien
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Logic
03C48 (Primary), 03C45, 03C52, 03C55, 03C75, 03E55 (Secondary)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We use orthogonality calculus to prove a downward transfer from categoricity in a successor in abstract elementary classes (AECs) that have a good frame (a forking-like notion for types of singletons) on an interval of cardinals: $\mathbf{Theorem}$ Let $K$ be an AEC and let $\text{LS} (K) \le \lambda < \theta$ be cardinals. If $K$ has a type-full good $[\lambda, \theta]$-frame and $K$ is categorical in both $\lambda$ and $\theta^+$, then $K$ is categorical in all $\lambda' \in [\lambda, \theta]$. We deduce improvements on the threshold of several categoricity transfers that do not mention frames. For example, the threshold in Shelah's transfer can be improved assuming that the AEC is tame: $\mathbf{Corollary}$ Let $K$ be a $\text{LS} (K)$-tame AEC with amalgamation. If $K$ is categorical in some successor $\lambda \ge \beth_{\left(2^{\text{LS} (K)}\right)^+}$, then $K$ is categorical in all $\lambda' \ge \beth_{\left(2^{\text{LS} (K)}\right)^+}$. Assuming that the AEC has primes over sets of the form $M \cup \{a\}$, the successor hypothesis can be removed from the previous corollary. It can also be removed by heavily using results of Shelah and assuming the weak generalized continuum hypothesis: $\textbf{Corollary}$ Assume $2^\theta < 2^{\theta^+}$ for every cardinal $\theta$, as well as an unpublished claim of Shelah. Let $K$ be a $\text{LS} (K)$-tame AEC with amalgamation. If $K$ is categorical in some $\lambda \ge \beth_{\left(2^{\text{LS} (K)}\right)^+}$, then $K$ is categorical in all $\lambda' \ge \beth_{\left(2^{\text{LS} (K)}\right)^+}$.
Comment: 62 pages. Was previously named "A downward categoricity transfer for tame abstract elementary classes"
